techmeme.title: Twilio reports Q1 revenue up 12% YoY to $1.17B, 335K+ active customer accounts vs. 313K+ in Q1 2024, and Q2 revenue forecast above est.; TWLO jumps 8%+ (Yahoo Finance)
Apple plans to source more than 19B chips from the US this year, including from TSMC's expanding Arizona facilities, as it seeks to lessen its reliance on China (Bloomberg)
Rockstar Games delays the release of Grand Theft Auto VI from fall 2025 to May 26, 2026, saying it needs extra time to deliver the expected and deserved quality (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Microsoft says new accounts will be "passwordless by default", asking people to use more secure methods like passkeys, push notifications, and security keys (Umar Shakir/The Verge)
Ireland's DPC fines TikTok €530M for illegally sending user data to China, ordering a halt to EU data transfers in six months if protections aren't guaranteed (Sam Schechner/Wall Street Journal)
